snippet: As a 72-hour truce mediated by Egypt took hold, Israel said it had withdrawn its forces from Gaza and Hamas said it would engage in talks on a lasting peace arrangement.
abstract: Israel announces withdrawal of all its forces from Gaza Strip as 72-hour cease-fire mediated by Egypt takes hold; both sides say they will engage in talks on a lasting arrangement to keep the peace; Gaza officials say more than 1,830 Palestinians have died since conflict began; Israel says 64 of its soldiers and three civilians have been killed.

byline.original: By STEVEN ERLANGER and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger reported from Jerusalem, and Ben Hubbard from Gaza City. Jodi Rudoren and Fares Akram contributed reporting from Gaza.

lead_paragraph: As a 72-hour truce mediated by Egypt took hold, Israel said it had withdrawn its forces from Gaza and Hamas said it would engage in talks on a lasting peace arrangement.

headline.main: Israel Exits Gaza as Truce Begins
headline.print_headline: Israel Exits Gaza; Truce Takes Hold
